intro: Sersalisia euphlebia, commonly known as the white-flowered sersalisia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are ovate and often have a hairy texture. Sersalisia euphlebia is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
